title: Hensol Forest Walking Route

images.title: Kev Griffin / Pysgodlyn Mawr, Hensol Forest
images.caption: Pysgodlyn Mawr, Hensol Forest

images.title: Mick Lobb / Forest edge, Hensol Forest
images.caption: Forest edge, Hensol Forest. The bright edge of the forest track contrast strongly with its dark interior. With virtually all the light blocked out by the canopy of pines, nothing will grow on the forest floor until they are harvested.

images.title: John Lord / Steps from carpark to picnic area, Hensol Forest
images.caption: Steps from the car park to picnic area, Hensol Forest

images.title: Mick Lobb / Forestry walk, Hensol Forest
images.caption: Forestry walk, Hensol Forest

images.title: Mick Lobb / A stand of pines, Hensol Forest
images.caption: A stand of pines. These trees stand at the access to another of the forests walks.

images.title: Mick Lobb / Field and view north of Hensol Forest
images.caption: Field and view north of the forest. Snow capped mountains can be seen in the background.

description: These expansive woods in the Vale of Glamorgan have miles of fine trails to try. You can start the walk from the parking area just to the north of Welsh St Donats. From here you can pick up the trails heading south east to the pretty lake known in Welsh as Pysgodlyn Mawr. It's a lovely tranquil spot with the lake flanked by the attractive woodland. After rounding the lake you return to the car park where there's a picnic site to relax in. You could extend the walk by continuing south east to visit the mill pond at Warren Mill Farm.
county: Bro Morgannwg - the Vale of Glamorgan
